name: InterfaceAddress
comment:
This class represents a Network Interface address. In short it's an
 IP address, a subnet mask and a broadcast address when the address is
 an IPv4 one. An IP address and a network prefix length in the case
 of IPv6 address.

methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: Returns an {@code InetAddress} for this address.

methods.name: getBroadcast
methods.comment:
Returns an {@code InetAddress} for the broadcast address for this InterfaceAddress.

Only IPv4 networks have broadcast address therefore, in the case of an IPv6 network, {@code null} will be returned.

methods.name: getNetworkPrefixLength
methods.comment:
Returns the network prefix length for this address. This is also known as the subnet mask in the context of IPv4 addresses. Typical IPv4 values would be 8 (255.0.0.0), 16 (255.255.0.0) or 24 (255.255.255.0).

Typical IPv6 values would be 128 (::1/128) or 10 (fe80::203:baff:fe27:1243/10)

methods.name: equals
methods.comment:
Compares this object against the specified object. The result is {@code true} if and only if the argument is not {@code null} and it represents the same interface address as this object.

Two instances of {@code InterfaceAddress} represent the same address if the InetAddress, the prefix length and the broadcast are the same for both.

methods.name: hashCode
methods.comment: Returns a hashcode for this Interface address.

methods.name: toString
methods.comment:
Converts this Interface address to a {@code String}. The
 string returned is of the form: InetAddress / prefix length [ broadcast address ].
